column2: Xsolis System Project-AI integration for UM XSOLIS
column3: Utilization Management Solution using AI to help determine patient eligabilty and appropriateness for status and reimbursement.

System Project ALM 4343
Oracle readmission prevention System Project being implemented in CAREB & ECISA in March 2025. Time consuming- 3-5 meetings a week. 
Validation Dates: 2 weeks per domain

Week of Feb 17 MOCKB

Week of March 3 MOCKA

Soft Activation: 

Week of Mar 17 (ECISA and CAREB the same week)

Go-Live: 

Week of April 22 CAREB and ECISA

Plan of Care

The Patient’s Plan of Care (POC) requires interprofessional collaboration to align assessments, interventions, and evaluations with patient-centered goals and outcomes.
Establishing Interprofessional Plan of Care Council (IPCC) for system-wide clinical and operational decision-making.  
Inaugural kick off council meeting planned for September 24, 2025. 
Work with IPCC team and Elsevier to manage practice decisions and support clinical adoption.

column2: Critical Care Titration & Block Charting Initiative 3991/CHI 4371
column3:
Titrations of Critical Care (Shared Folder)
Critical Care Gtt CI Tracking Dashboard 

System-wide policy to standardize IV titrations block charting.
A System Titrations Policy Toolkit has been released by the C5 Clinical Institute to support this rollout.
Go-live Timeline:
South region (TX/TN/KY) Epic sites went live September 6, aligned with the Epic upgrade.
Other Epic markets are scheduled to go live November 2025 due to upgrade priorities.
Continued phased go-live timeline may be found here: EHR Go-Live Date Schedule for the Titrations in Continuous Infusion Medications in Critical Care Areas P&P

column3:
Intake Slide ALM 4139

System-wide updates to the Liberation/ABCDEF Bundle guidelines are underway and will require significant changes across all EHR platforms.
Market-level crosswalk reviews have been completed.
Initial EHR intake form submitted by Brenda Downs on February 28, 2025.
Revised EHR change request submitted on June 18, 2025; currently under intake review by System Clinical Informatics leadership.

column2: NCEC - Standard Orientation Content Task Force
column3: Serve in a consultative capacity, supporting all five defined workgroups by addressing informatics/technology-related needs.

column2: Med Rec Tasking in Cerner ALM 3713
column3:
Design Session #3 occurred on 1/10/2024, during which participants shared feedback from their respective markets on the following topics:

Removing "reconciliation" from the medication history task name.
Removing the task type from Care Compass.

Participants reached voting consensus to move forward with proposed changes. Technical team confirmed sufficient information to implement design changes in a non-prod environment.  


Approved by Cerner Optimization Group on 2/6. Build resources assigned. Testing/validation completed for CRDB/A. Go-live occurred March 2025.

column2: National Clinical Education Council (NCEC) - SCI Consultant
column3: NCEC council representative. Monthly initiative update highlighting key System Projects/system initiatives and new policies, timelines, and progress across the enterprise.

OralKleen System Project Jan2025

System-wide policy and procedure for interventional oral hygiene and infection prevention.
Documentation and procedural elements of the new policy have been finalized.
Executive Directors Tammie Kear and Virginia Pendergast will discuss and initial go-live facility site selection with Ron Yolo, RCNO–California Region.
On 8/28, a meeting was held in partnership with the System Clinical Informaticists to gather intake request information for submission to System Informatics leadership for review.
System Clinical Informaticists will continue collaborating with the task force to refine EHR requirements in preparation for pilot rollout.

WFM System Project 2025

IT Enterprise Transition to Kronos Suite (Replacing Clairvia and Teams Scheduling Tools)

On April 25, 2025, a meeting was held with Michelle Gunsher and Boomie to discuss the Clairvia transition to Pro WFM.

Direction was provided to prioritize the Care Value System Team—the Owner user group of Clairvia—for Wave 1 of the transition.

A demo was recommended for this group to facilitate engagement and gather feedback or concerns.

Michelle was also advised to engage Regional/Market Clinical Informatics Leaders to identify local Change Champions to support the transition.

Follow-up meeting held with System Project managers on May 28, 2025 to continue planning and coordination efforts.

Follow-up with Epic related to alignment of Kronos acuity with Epic Gold and building blocks for acuity mapping. Email exchange for initiative and resourcing sent on 9/8.
Consulting with WICI leaders and Amrit on current wikki materials.
